ResponsesInList.Title: Re: TeX and Alg notation problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Have you upgraded recently? Sounds like you you should check permissions of your mimetex.xxx (needs to be executable file) in folder filter/tex - algebra filter is using the files of tex filter and also filter/algebra/algebra2tex.pl needs to be executable. People often forget to check these permissions when they upload new files over/to the place of old files.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: TeX and Alg notation problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mauno, Thanks for your suggestion.  I work with Craig so my response is regarding the same issue.  Here's a little more information. In our testing environment Tex and Algebra filters work great.  On our production environment it does not.  I cannot figure out the problem.  Both systems are running in the same VM version of the VM environment, same kernel, same distro, same Moodle version, etc. Permissions are correct, the file has the right file size, and it is set to executable. I can open the file and read it, but when I execute from the CLI I get "File not found."  It's strange.  I finally got Tex working by installing ImageMagick, Latex, and TexLive.  However, the Algebra filter seems to still want to use the mimetex.linux file.  This is where the problem lies.  Is there a way to tell Algebra filter to use the Latex/ImageMagick combo instead of mimetex.linux?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: TeX and Alg notation problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Are there any restrictions in php for open_basedir or some security modules that could restrict access to some files or folders? And you did not get any errors in debugging ...filter/tex/texdebug.php or ...filter/algebra/algebradebug.php ? ( set debugging first to ALL from Site administration > Development > Debugging ) You did not mention if it is moodle 2.X or 1.9.X ... and I have not used algebra filter on production sites (only tested it some years ago) but debugging or server error logs should tell the reason for this issue ( it can be some setting of php, level of error reporting, disabled functions of php, some .htaccess file, ... ) Do you have some other filters enabled in Site administration > Plugins > Filters > Manage filters ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Plots in STACK MCQ, option label
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, if I use plots as the display in a STACK multiple choice question, the options "xlabel", "ylabel" and "label" are not supported, although they are supported outside the MCQ -"model answer". Can I do anything about this or is it just a limitation in the current version of STACK? Stephan.

ResponsesInList.Title: STACK Matrix input type creates new lines
ResponsesInList.Text: I've been experimenting with STACK questions with matrices and vectors for answers, and have found that, when using the matrix input type, the matrix of input boxes always appears on a new line. Is there any way to avoid this? Ideally I want to have inline vector input, something like \(x = v + \lambda_1 w_1 + \lambda_2 w_2\) where \(v, w_1, w_2\) are vector (i.e. matrix) inputs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: STACK Matrix input type creates new lines
ResponsesInList.Text:
Thomas, Yes, this is very annoying.  I consider it a bug in STACK, but the truth is that the bug is caused by a subtle interaction between STACK, the editor, the MathJax filter and other clean up code in Moodle. Imagine we have the following question text ```text ```

Find vectors so that \( v = \lambda_1 \) input:ans1 \(+\lambda_2 \) input:ans2

validation:ans1 validation:ans2

In the various transformations between the teacher and the students the "inputs" get replaced by tables, and the maths text gets processed by the mathjax filter.  This leads to spans with class "filter_mathjaxloader_equation" containing an opening paragraph

, but with the span closing before the table for the input.   We get something like this ```text

Find vectors so that \( v = \lambda_1 \) .... ``` Then later in Moodle, the closing

is inserted by some later Moodle cleaning up code.  All very helpful, but it breaks the display! One way to avoid (workaround) the problem is to switch off the TinyMCE editor: go to ' Administration > Site administration > Plugins > Text editors > Manage editors ' Then don't use paragraph (`

`) tags in your question text. This is all very well until someone comes along and edits the question later and the editor puts back in paragraph tags for you.... I would very much appreciate some help here from people with more knowledge of Moodle about how STACK can adapt to stop this bug.  Any suggestions?  Sorry I don't know more about the text editors and filters in Moodle to know exactly what to do here. [B****Y editor keeps changing my pre tags when I try to post an accurate description of this problem!]

ResponsesInList.Title: More freedom for students answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I would like to enable my students to answer using more complicated expressions. This currently is made out of two parts: 1) I would like to set the default questions behavior to alow floating point numbers. 2) I would like to alow students to use complicated expressions in thier answers. The reason for this is mainly that I use my home-made units-testing answers, so I need my students to be able to type in the units, some of which are three letters (or even 4 letters) long. I know I can alow them specific words in each question, but this just wouldent do, as it requiers a long list of allowed words to be copied to each question and there are to many chanses for errors. So I would like to do one of two things - either have some global list of alowed words that can be used in all of the questions on my moodle environament, or to just allow students to type in any three letter long expression. What can I do? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: More freedom for students answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Have a look at these add-ons from the OU: https://moodle.org/plugins/search.php?s=varnum Also, if you want to go further with maths questions, check-out STACK https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=qtype_stack

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: More freedom for students answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, You can set site defaults for STACK questions to allow floating point numbers. Adding support in STACK for scientific units is needed, but I haven't had time to do this yet. It would be a very interesting "extra input", and there are some interesting challenges.  E.g. if a student types in m/s and you wanted km/h it is possible to convert between the two and say "correct answer, wrong units".  It would also be useful to be able to give feedback on units (treating them with dimensional analysis). Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: More freedom for students answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tim and Chris, Thanks for the answers. First to set the recored straight - I am already using STACK in my course.  Also, we already discussed the Units Issue in: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=253359#p1101207 I am currently using units in my questions, and I built some functions to support  units analysis which includes: 1) The ability to transform all units to one specific units system, to compare answers (such as in your example above for the m/s to Km/h). 2) the ability to compare the units of the students answer with the correct one. 3) the ability to choose the list of equivalent units. 4) adding constants which have units, for student usage. 5) checking that an equation or expression have equivalent units (that is m+s =s is not allowed). Other features I would like to have: 6) The ability to enter three and four letters "units" - this is very important to me, and if there is a way to do it with the current version of stack, I would like to know how. 7) One global units transitions map that will be maintained in one place, and can be excessed from every question. 8) The ability to check the arguments of exponents and trigonometric functions have no units. --> I have not  build the ability to differentiate between (m/s) and (Km/h) as I see no scenario in which I would like to correct a student for working in his own chosen units system - and if he "mashes" together to unit systems, it will reflect itself in the final answer. I remind you again my question relating to item 6. cheers, gilad

ResponsesInList.Title: MathML issue: students see the actual code MathML
ResponsesInList.Text:

xmlns=¨ http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML ¨»«mi»A«/mi»«/math», nous utilisons
l'algorithme de la puissance qui suit pour calculer la valeur propre «math
xmlns=¨ http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML ¨»«mi»§#955;«/mi»«/math» For some reason, the filter MathJax is understanding that this is a mathML format and students don't see the correct format. I tried to enter «math, as a additional equation delimiters in MathJax, but it didn't work. One of the suggestion is to convert it into an HTML but it is not something practical to change all questions: Replacing With « (#AB) < (#3C) » (#BB) > (#3E) § (#A7) & (#26) ¨ (#A8) " (#22) ` (#60) ' (#27) Any idea what should I do to fix it ? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MathML issue: students see the actual code MathML
ResponsesInList.Text: Were these wiris questions or something else? I do not know why you have #3C encoded as #AD. That is not standard mathML so I would not be surprized that MathaJax does not recognize it. Did making the changes suggested above work?

ResponsesInList.Title: Stack Answer tests
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm enjoying and playing with my new stack and maxima installation. I saw the extensive answer test provided in stack config but, I would like to try them by hand on a maxima consol. For example, I tryed (%i)CasEqual(x+1,1+x); ... That didn't give anything captivating.  So how can play with the different answer test directly in maxima ? There no topic 'CasEqual' in maxima is that normal? and thanks again for STACK .. I love what I can do with it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Stack Answer tests
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok, I think I got it. To test CasEqual for example, I can write: (%i1)if x+1=1+x then true else false; and the test how simp change the result.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Stack Answer tests
ResponsesInList.Text: Malik, Yes, good question.  We already thought of this!  It is a very useful thing to do. See https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack/blob/master/doc/en/CAS/STACK-Maxima_sandbox.md Most of the Answer tests start with AT.....  For example ATAlgEquiv(sa,ta). ATCASEqual(2,2); The syntax for tests with an option is ATInt(x^3/3+c,[x^3/3,x]) i.e. you need to tell STACK the teacher's answer and variable. They are defined in https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack/blob/master/stack/maxima/assessment.mac https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack/blob/master/stack/maxima/stackmaxima.mac (At one time I thought it would be useful to separate out the API from the "assessment package" but ran out of emotional steam). To see what the functions return, see lines 389 onwards of https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack/blob/master/stack/maxima/stackmaxima.mac The cryptic feedback strings are defined in the language file, e.g. https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack/blob/master/lang/en/qtype_stack.php Lastly, the *whole point* of these functions is to avoid (as far as possible) writing things like "if sa=ta then mark:1 else mark:0" and replace such things with tests for specific properties. Comments and suggestions welcome. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Stack Answer tests
ResponsesInList.Text: I think Chris may have a type. I think ATInt(x^3/3+c,[x^3/3,x]) should be ATInt(x^3/3+c,x^3/3,[x]) That is, the first to arguments are expressions, and the third argument (the options) is a list.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Stack Answer tests
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok, great I had seen the STACK-Maxima_sandbox.md file but I had not understood what it was for exactly. especialy those two lines `file_search_maxima:append([sconcat("C:/maxima/###.{mac,mc}")],file_search_maxima)$ file_search_lisp:append([sconcat("C:/maxima/###.{lisp}")],file_search_lisp)$` It become clear now. The enable maxima to find stack functions. thanks

My questions are as follows: 1 ) In the documentation it mentions that Maxima 5.25.1 to 5.31.3 are supported - do I need to install one of those version ? or will STACK run with 5.32.1 ? 2 ) Running the STACK healthcheck amongst the errors I get: "loadfile: failed to load /usr/share/maxima/5.32.1/share/draw/draw.lisp". So, if you can install from https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack please do. If not, hopefully I will get the new version into the plugins directory this week.

Kind regards, David

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problems installing STACK on Ubuntu Server
ResponsesInList.Text: It all comes down to what you mean by "Latest version". What really happens it that Chris, and a few other peole, work away at the code on github. So, the very latest code is aways there, but it is being changed, and we may accidentally break stuff from time to time. Then, every so often, when we are fairly sure that nothing is broken, we take the latest version on github, call it a release, and put that snapshot into the plugins database. So if you install from github, you have the very latest code, but there is a small risk. If you install from the plugins database, it is safer, but you may be a bit behind the latest developments. As it happens, I found something broken yesterday, so I am glad I did not do a release last week. I will try to fix it today, then do the release.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problems installing STACK on Ubuntu Server
ResponsesInList.Text:
Might be useful for someone, we managed to make default version of Maxima in Debian Jessie (Maxima 5.34.1 and GCL 2.6.12) work without any issues, thus no need to compile anything or backport. You need optimised version of maxima bundle created using documentation , then it works smooth and there are no errors in health-check. Step-by step guide for you, courtesy of Lancaster University CIS: 1. In Moodle STACK configuration set "Platform type" to "Linux" (not optimised) and "Maxima command" to empty value. Run the health-check script. It may contain errors which could be ignored, scroll to "Debug info" > " Context use", it should contain something similar to: 
```text
Platform: unix-optimised
Maxima shell command: maxima
Maxima initial command: load("/srv/data/moodle/stack/maximalocal.mac");


Maxima timeout: 10
```
 The Maxima initial command above is the one we need to produce optimised version. 2. Login to one of the web-servers, become root. Check what maxima version we have and what the LISP implementation is in use: 
```text
root@moodle:~# maxima --list-avail
Available versions:
version 5.34.1, lisp gcl
```
 gcl is the default implementation in Debian, and we will use it. Thus, the portion of maxima optimising documentation we need is GCL . 3. Run maxima and load /srv/data/moodle/stack/maximalocal.mac using command in step 1 above: 
```text
root@moodle:~# maxima
Maxima 5.34.1 
http://maxima.sourceforge.net

using Lisp GNU Common Lisp (GCL) GCL 2.6.12 (a.k.a. GCL)
Distributed under the GNU Public License. See the file COPYING.
Dedicated to the memory of William Schelter.
The function bug_report() provides bug reporting information.
(%i1) load("/srv/data/moodle/stack/maximalocal.mac");
```
 It should output something similar to: 
```text
Compiling /usr/share/maxima/5.34.1/share/draw/grcommon.lisp.
End of Pass 1.  
End of Pass 2.  
OPTIMIZE levels: Safety=2, Space=3, Speed=3

End of Pass 2.

Finished compiling /root/.maxima/binary/binary-gcl/share/draw/gnuplot.o.
Loading /root/.maxima/binary/binary-gcl/share/draw/gnuplot.o
start address -T 0x25faf00 Finished loading /root/.maxima/binary/binary-gcl/share/draw/gnuplot.o
Compiling /usr/share/maxima/5.34.1/share/draw/vtk.lisp.
End of Pass 1.  
End of Pass 2.

start address -T 0x263de70 Finished loading /root/.maxima/binary/binary-gcl/share/draw/vtk.o

Loading /root/.maxima/binary/binary-gcl/share/draw/picture.o
start address -T 0x26640b0 Finished loading /root/.maxima/binary/binary-gcl/share/draw/picture.o
Loading maxima-grobner $Revision: 1.6 $ $Date: 2009-06-02 07:49:49 $
[ STACK-Maxima started, library version 2015090900 ]

```
 If you have already run the load command before and graphical libraries ( /usr/share/maxima/5.34.1/share/draw/grcommon.lisp ) have been compiled already, the output might be shorter: 
```text

Loading maxima-grobner $Revision: 1.6 $ $Date: 2009-06-02 07:49:49 $
[ STACK-Maxima started, library version 2015090900 ] 
(%o0) "/srv/data/moodle/stack/maximalocal.mac"
```
 Notice, that compiling /usr/share/maxima/5.34.1/share/draw/grcommon.lisp require gcc to be installed in the system. 4. Without leaving maxima console, same optimised binary in Moodle data directory: 
```text
(%i1) :lisp (si::save-system "/srv/data/moodle/stack/maxima-optimised")
```
 5. Now it is time to reconfigure Moodle. In Moodle STACK configuration set "Platform type" to " Linux (optimised) ". Set "Maxima command" to: 
```text
timeout --kill-after=10s 10s /srv/data/moodle/stack/maxima-optimised -eval '(cl-user::run)'
```
 The above format will make sure that command is never run for more than 10 seconds, thus will not cause performance issues. Save the configuration. Now run the health-check script, scroll down and press "Clear the cache". The loaded health check result should contain no errors. If you see some broken formula images, but health-check does not report errors, this has nothing to do with maxima or STACK, check TeX Notation filter settings, you most likely do not have texlive package installed on your system. (sorry for styling issues, pasting it from internal wiki)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problems installing STACK on Ubuntu Server

ResponsesInList.Title: jsxgraph encoding issues
ResponsesInList.Text:
Dear all, I am reaching out with an issue I have been unable to resolve on my own, the problem I believe boils down to an issue with JSXgraph and encodings. In its simplest form I created short answer question (I started with a formula type question but the problem applies to question types provided by the default Moodle installation). As advised on JSXgraph page using Plain Text Editor with HTML format I created three tags:

as the question text (the rest is not important). The first tag contains (three) letters from the English alphabet, the second contains a single letter from either the Cyrillic or Turkish alphabet, the last one is a copy paste from the jsxgraph examples where a simple board is created. When I preview the question I obtain the following error Exception - DOMDocument::loadHTML(): Argument #1 ($source) must not be empty when I remove the second paragraph (containing non-english symbols) the question renders the expected jsxgraph board. If from the administrator interface I change the JSXgraph plugin (Coding between tags->convert encoding) to "No" and bring back the Cyrillic paragraph, the page renders the correct JSXgraph but the Cyrillic texts is not properly displayed, similar to the errors described in the following post https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=241878 I cannot apply the solution described in the above post ( it is from 2013 and jsxgraph/filter.php does not contain such line). I am using Moodle 4.5.3+ Build 20250321 and JSXgraph v1.10.1 - additions (2025-02-26) This ticket https://github.com/jsxgraph/moodle-filter_jsxgraph/issues/48 appears to be a related issue but the solution there did not apply as well. The following post https://stackoverflow.com/questions/77370472/domdocumentloadhtml-source-must-not-be-empty-error-when-inputting-result-fro leads me to believe the issue is somewhere on how information is passed to and from the jsxgraph filter. On the server I have multiple formula-type questions that are either in Turkish or Bulgarian and for those questions everything renders as expected. I see this issue only when including a JSXgraph tag, hence I do not believe it is an issue with how the operating system is set. If it helps: for some of my formula type questions I experienced a correct behavior when the jsxgraph tag is the last tag in the question text (correct rendering of Cyrillic and graph). Should there be any tags after the graph I receive the above error. I will appreciate any assistance!

ResponsesInList.Title: jsMath, algebra filter, and documentation
ResponsesInList.Text: We'd like to test jsMath with moodle, and have a couple of related questions. Is any documentation available on howto install jsMath with moodle? Will jsmath coexist with the moodle algebra filter? The jsMath filter is not listed o the moodle filters download page ... Is there any reason for this? Thanks, Lars.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: jsMath, algebra filter, and documentation
ResponsesInList.Text: Is any documentation available on howto install jsMath with moodle? Yes, there is a README file that contains the installation instructions. See the jsMath filter CVS site. Will jsmath coexist with the moodle algebra filter? I've never used the algebra filter, but it should not be hard to use them in conjunction with each other. You will need to set the configuration of the jsMath filter so that it will use characters other than the ones used by algebra filter to indicate the start and stop mathematics. By default, jsMath uses \(...\) or <tex>...</tex> to indicate in-line mathematics and \[...\] or $$..$$ to indicate display mathematics. If the algebra filter uses these, you can set them to something else in the jsmath/ javascript .php file and jsmath/filter.php files. The jsMath filter is not listed o the moodle filters download page... Is there any reason for this? The jsMath filter is one of the user-contributed filters, of which there are several dozen (see the contrib CVS site). Only the official filters and modules are listed on the download page. Davide

Thanks, Stuart.

ResponsesInList.Title: New bug fixes for algebra/mathml filters
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm attaching new versions of the algebra/mathml->gif filters. The new versions contain a bug fix for the problem Mark Hughes was experiencing with the filters. The problem was due to the way mimetex.cgi looks for its TeX inputs. It first checks the environment variable $QUERY_STRING for its inputs, before looking at its arguments. On Mark's server , Apache /PHP exports its value of $QUERY_STRING (typically something like "id=x&....") to subprocesses launched by php scripts. The fix clears $QUERY_STRING before launching mimetex.cgi. [If you are downloading the filters for the first time, you will need to get additional files from the anonymous cvs in the contrib/algebra and contrib/mathml directories.] I tried to update the CVS, but it seems to be down since last night.

ResponsesInList.Title: Aligned equations in jsMath?
ResponsesInList.Text: I have given my students a forum called "My favourite piece of mathematics" and asked every student to make one post. This has been a big success, with many students posting very interesting things. A large number of them had the need to typeset multi-line equations, something I would usually do with the eqnarray environment or even better with the AMSLatex equation environments. Davide, do you have any plans of catering for aligned equations in the future?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Aligned equations in jsMath?
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm glad your assignment was a success. Sounds like a good one. As for aligned equations, jsMath already supports TeX's \eqalign and LaTeX's eqnarray environment, but you need to use it in math mode (so that jsMath will process it). As for the AMS environments, I've considered it, but haven't had the chance to work on them, and I may not be able to get all the features worked out. JsMath also implements TeX's \displaylines macro, and there are the array and various matrix environments. If these are not sufficient for now, let me know and we'll see what can be worked out. Davide

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Aligned equations in jsMath?
ResponsesInList.Text: Davide, I had not realized that I can use eqnarray in jsMath. That is very good. Do you have a full list of the environments and commands that jsMath implements? I will now extend my filter.php so that it replaces any \begin{eqnarray} by \$\$\begin{eqnarray} and any \end{eqnarray} by \end{eqnarray}\$\$ (Without the backslashes, they are shown only because moodle.org is using a less intelligent TeX filter than yours). Then my students can use eqnarrays in the usual way.

ResponsesInList.Title: LaTeX not "properly" working
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, I have emailed our Moodle tech guy at our university, but he does not know the answer unfortunately. Perhaps someone in these forums can help. I'm having trouble getting TeX to work properly in Moodle. I have read the documentation, and sometimes it works properly, but there are certain things that don't. I have a feeling I know why (some notation requires other LaTeX packages that don't seem to be part of the Moodle implementation of LaTeX) so I would like to know if there's a way to get these working. For example: 1. If I type $$ \int_a^b f(x) dx $$ THIS WORKS.  But, 2. If I type $$ \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} $$ , THIS does NOT work. The second command works on a local implementation of LaTeX on my computer but, of course, only after adding "\usepackage{amsmath}" at the top of the .tex file. I tried adding this command in between the $$ $$ directly into the Moodle editor, but still no luck (didn't figure it would work but it was worth a try). I have attached a pdf file outlining what these are supposed to look like on Moodle (though, I'm sure you know already). Again, the first one works, but the second one (and hence, anything else that requires that or any other package) does not. This is severely limiting what you can do with LaTeX on Moodle. I have also tried the Java math editor, but that doesn't produce the desired results either. Please note I have gone into my settings and ensured that the TeX filter is ON. There is NO filter for MathJax available on our implementation and I don't think they are going to allow it so I'm looking for an alternate solution if possible (preferrably, one that does not involve uploading images, but I will do that if there's no other way!) Any help would be greatly appreciated... thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: LaTeX not "properly" working
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Justin, The TeX notation filter uses requires some binary executables to be able to run on the server . If there is a full install of LaTeX (usally TeXLive distribution) on the server, the filter will use this. This is normally configured to include amsmath, but the included packages can be changed with an administration settings. If full LaTeX is not installed on the server, then the filter will attempt to use a copy of a smaller program call mimeTeX. This does not include much of amstex and is not configurable. It also produces lower quality images. If this is the problem, you would need to install the LaTeX binary packages or you MathJaX to fix it. Which version of Moodle are you using? Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: LaTeX not "properly" working
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel, thanks for your reply. We are using 2.5 and I just heard back from the helpdesk that it is indeed using mimeTeX (I directed him to your reply and he researched the answer). So according to this, I'm assuming nothing can be done for now (other than images)?  They are actually planning on upgrading to 2.8 soon.

ResponsesInList.Title: New mathematical question type for quiz module
ResponsesInList.Text: As part of the Serving Maths project we have developed a new mathematical question type that is rendered and scored with the help of a computer algebra system. This allows a lot more flexibility in randomizing questions and assessing student answers and giving feedback. We invite you to try out a few quizzes in the software demo section of our project web site and to author your own questions in the Teacher Demo course. The new question type is powered by the STACK assessment system which in turn uses the Maxima computer algebra system. Luckily you will not have to install any of this software in order to use the new question type because it consumes these as web services that can be running anywhere on the web and for now we are providing web services for this. All our software is open-source and GPL and we encourage collaboration.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New mathematical question type for quiz module
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, the plan is to make the new quiz module part of Moodle 1.5 beta at the end of this week. That will give Moodle a) the ability to handle adaptive questions and b) an RQP web services interface so that it can use questions that are rendered and scored by external applications like STACK or AiM. However I would not use this in production service until extensive beta testing has been completed, expected to last several weeks.

ResponsesInList.Title: STACK: Problem with syntax hint if input type is "units"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'd like to provide reasonable syntax hints on what type of answer is expected like "expression", "number" or "number with unit" This works fine for numeric or algebraic input type but not for units input type. In the latter case, the hint attribute is ignored and the behaviour is as if "value" was given, regardless of my selection "placeholder" (which I'd prefer). Is this a known bug or feature? Can I do anything about it? Martin Kraska

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: STACK: Problem with syntax hint if input type is "units"
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for reporting this Martin, I think this is related to this issue: https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack/issues/561 If not, pleas email me a specific example and I'll look into it. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Using MathML
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, The problem is as follows: I added a page as a resource. In the page content editor, I pasted some mathml code using html source editor. It was embeded and displayed correctly. Now while adding a question, I again used the html source editor and pasted the same mathml code. But this time the editor striped off all the mark-ups and only dispayed the text. Please help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using MathML
ResponsesInList.Text: Editor (tinymce) is not stripping those mathml tags - stripping is done by other library files of moodle. Before moodle 2.3 weblib.php used to have $ALLOWED_TAGS that controlled allowed tags in such activities that students were able to edit but if I have understood it correct the latest versions of moodle have some new code for using "trusted content". Which version of moodle is it and can you give a tiny example of the code you included? Could you also give the problematic question type - some question types allow only certain kind of text input... (otherwise one workaround might be to use some custom editor plugin and filter to input/output/translate mathml)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using MathML
ResponsesInList.Text: I am not sure anymore why those mathml tags were stripped but in a quick test with moodle 2.2 I was able to add the tags to numerical and multiple choice questions by editing my profile and changing the setting "When editing text - Use standard web forms" (no editor) and selecting HTML format under each textarea where mathml was needed (not moodle autoformat). You could try to ask this issue on Quiz forum although cross-posting is not usually the best way to get answers but in this case people on that forum might know better the reason and possible fix

ResponsesInList.Title: stack_include error
ResponsesInList.Text: Since I am one of the people alway asking for the inclusion of external maxima-files I wanted to try the stack_include command. Unfortunatly, I always get an error that #1 couldn't be retrieved. The file is an ordinary txt-file, and I can open it in my browser. The QuestionVariables are just: a:rand(10); b:rand(20); stack_include(" https://www.mathematik.uni-kassel.de/~heschmpo/test_include.txt "); lsng:addOneMore(a,b) Is there anything I overlooked? Best regards Hendrikje

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: stack_include error
ResponsesInList.Text:
What STACK version are you using? The include feature has been introduced in Version 4.4. if I recall correctly. Something like the following works for me: 
```text
     stack_include("
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mkraska/meclib/main/Maxima/fb_value.mac
");
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: stack_include error
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, the moodle-enviroment, I tried to use it, runs on Version 4.4.2 (moodle 3.9.20), so I think that should work. But unfotionatlyy I am not even able to save my question with the stack_input, since I always get this "stack_include, could not retrieve: #1"- error. I looked at your file, is it necessary to use the %_ for variables? Thanks, Hendrikje

ResponsesInList.Title: mbox blacklisted
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all. I have already written a lot of formulas containing the \mbox command. After an upgrade to the last 1.9.4-weekly-Moodle, suddenly I discovered the mbox command blacklisted. Now I would delete it from the tex_blacklist array in lib.php. Is there any security issue in doing that? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: mbox blacklisted
ResponsesInList.Text: The original reason for blacklisting \mbox was http://bugs.kde.org/103026 It is still very unlikely that you or any user of your site could misuse \mbox or \line Commands like \input, \include or \write are dangerous ones and in practise you can do a lot with programming commands. I suppose you can use \mbox or \line on your site safely if you use it like it is ment to be used.

ResponsesInList.Title: Stack : choice of response test
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, How do I configure my potential response tree to accept 9/2 or 4.5 responses, but not (5 + 4)/2 ? I'm looking but can't find, if anyone could give me a clue ... Thanks in advance

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Stack : choice of response test
ResponsesInList.Text: It sounds like you need two nodes, both using equality up to commutativity/associativity, one for 9/2 and the other for 4.5. There isn't a single test which accepts both and also rejects (5+4)/2. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Stack : choice of response test
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Chris, Thank you for your answer, it is the beginning of a solution but unfortunately the TAns is a variable of the question generated randomly. I experimented, looked at the predicate functions, but I'm afraid this is all beyond my abilities as a beginner. If you could, you or someone else, look at the Prt2 of the question I am attaching to this post. Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Stack : choice of response test
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, in the field TAns you can just use `float(ta2)` . Of course, if using EqualComAss as the answer test, students will have to enter their answer without any rounding.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Stack : choice of response test
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stephan, Thanks, that's exactly what I was looking to do.

ResponsesInList.Title: STACK/Moodle 4.x: Too many arguments supplied to ct2_latex
ResponsesInList.Text: This is the first time I try STACK on Moodle 4, and I run into an obscure error which seems to be unknown by google. In a simple minimal example, just defining a function `f: x^2+x*y` and rendering this in the question as `{@f@}`, gives the following error. ``` This question generated an unexpected internal error. Please seek advice, e.g. from a teacher. Too many arguments supplied to ct2_latex(%_val,%_mode); found: [x*y+x^2,"i",_ct2_simp] The field ""Question text"" generated the following error: Too many arguments supplied to ct2_latex(%_val,%_mode); found: [x*y+x^2,"i",_ct2_simp] The field ""Question variables"" generated the following error: Too many arguments supplied to ct2_latex(%_val,%_mode); found: [x*y+x^2,"i",_ct2_simp] ``` This was using installations from github, MOODLE_400_STABLE for moodle and v4.4.2 for STACK, for the three question behaviours I simply used the master branch.  I have had the same error with different variations under Moodle 4.1 as well.  I see that the definition and usage of ct2_latex has changed between versions, but I have not read the code and have no clue what is really happening. Maxima is version 5.44.0, using the goemaxima docker image from https://hub.docker.com/r/mathinstitut/goemaxima PHP is version 8.0, but I don't suppose that makes a difference I suppose I must have found a bad combination of versions, but what would be the right combination?  Does anyone have any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: STACK/Moodle 4.x: Too many arguments supplied to ct2_latex
ResponsesInList.Text: What stackmaxima version is your goemaxima container running? It needs to strictly match the one required by the moodle side. For STACK v4.4.2 you need stackmaxima version ` 2023010400 ` which means the container name should be something like `mathinstitut/goemaxima: 2023010400-1.1.8 ` or `mathinstitut/goemaxima: 2023010400- latest`.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: STACK/Moodle 4.x: Too many arguments supplied to ct2_latex
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks a lot. That's the nail on the head. Sorry, I should have been aware of this. Its working out of the box for so long with different configurations had made me grown complacent.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: STACK/Moodle 4.x: Too many arguments supplied to ct2_latex
ResponsesInList.Text: This function was changed 9 months ago https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack/commit/bd7ea07905386bb3154c564b751f6c9b110bf125 I expect you have a new version of the PHP code pointing at an older version of compiled Maxima.  The solution is to regenerate your Maxima image, and you will need some admin rights to do this. Just to note, following the STACK conference in April we made it much harder to leave a system in this state after an upgrade, so this kind of problem should become apparent much quicker in future.  I.e. at upgrade time. Chris
